channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Power Is Restored in Spain and Portugal After Widespread Outage
item.description: Electricity was back in most of the two countries after a blackout that shut down much of daily life. The cause of the outage remained unclear.

item.title: White House Attacks Amazon Over Idea of Showing Tariffs’ Cost
item.description: The White House press secretary, Karoline Leavitt, attacked the retail giant over a report that suggested Amazon would highlight tariff-related price ...

item.title: Exclusive: Unto Labs raises $14.4 million from Framework Ventures and Electric Capital
item.description: The company will use the money raised in this round to expand its team.

item.title: Elon Musk’s retreat from DOGE has lifted Tesla’s market cap by $158 billion—but the stock is still 50% off its December peak
item.description: A TSLA stock rebound led to gains surpassing the current market caps of Amgen or Adobe.

item.title: With Trump In Power, Foreign Crypto Companies Make Inroads in US
item.description: The prime example is Tether, a firm that regulators once targeted. Its chief executive recently hobnobbed in Washington with lawmakers and lobbyists.

item.title: Tomasz Tunguz: Secondaries as the new IPO is no passing fad—it’s a VC evolution
item.description: Venture capital secondary activity nearly equals the private equity market now and is set to grow significantly.

item.title: People feel so bad about the economy because of tariffs and inflation that consumer confidence sank to a 13-year low
item.description: President Donald Trump’s tariff policies have largely impacted how consumers feel about the economy.

item.title: Amazon pours cold water on report saying it will show how tariffs affect each product’s price: ‘Never a consideration for the main Amazon site’
item.description: The White House originally called Amazon’s reported plan a “hostile and political act.”

item.title: Cardinal Who Threatened to Crash the Conclave Now Says He Won’t
item.description: The Vatican said that Francis had stripped a convicted cardinal, Angelo Becciu, of his right to vote for the next pope. Cardinal Becciu maintains his ...

item.title: U.S. Eases Ban for Diplomats at Vietnam War Anniversary
item.description: The administration had said that no senior U.S. envoys could attend the events marking 50 years after the war’s end. On Tuesday, the U.S. consul gener...

item.title: Power Is Restored in Spain and Portugal After Widespread Outage
item.description: Electricity was back in most of the two countries after a blackout that shut down much of daily life. The cause of the outage remained unclear.

item.title: Zelensky Calls Putin’s 72-Hour Truce Pledge in Russia-Ukraine War ‘Manipulation’
item.description: Russian forces launched 100 attack drones across Ukraine overnight, hours after President Vladimir V. Putin ordered a unilateral three-day cease-fire ...

item.title: How Photography From the Vietnam War Changed America
item.description: The images changed how the world saw Vietnam, but especially how Americans saw their country, soldiers and the war itself, which ended 50 years ago th...

item.description: The administration had said that no senior U.S. envoys could attend the events marking 50 years after the war’s end. On Tuesday, the U.S. consul gener...
